query: Can you list all the search keywords running in order by the ones that have the most conversions and include their cost per conversion?
sql:
SELECT gkp.ad_group_criterion_keyword_text AS keyword, 
gkp.ad_group_criterion_keyword_match_type AS match_type, 
SUM(gkp.metrics_conversions) AS total_conversions, 
SAFE_DIVIDE(SAFE_DIVIDE(SUM(gkp.metrics_cost_micros), 1000000), SUM(gkp.metrics_conversions)) AS cost_per_conversion
FROM advida-data-pipeline.manager_dataset_preprod_updated.google_ads_keyword_performance_2643649617 AS gkp
JOIN advida-data-pipeline.manager_dataset_preprod_updated.google_ads_campaign_details_2643649617 cd ON gkp.campaign_id = cd.campaign_id
WHERE gkp.customer_id = 3424742100
  AND cd.campaign_advertising_channel_type = 'SEARCH'
GROUP BY gkp.ad_group_criterion_keyword_text, gkp.ad_group_criterion_keyword_match_type
ORDER BY total_conversions DESC
instructions: Club the same text keywords. 'Group by' should only be on keyword text and keyword match type.
instructions_comment:
"Assuming the google derrived metric formula and the associated table information is getting passed in the general instructions.. 

also instructions like micros are passed in the general instructions"
